Detailed Description

reactor synchronization visitor

This class is used during a depth first in order to:

  • call the method newTick() on each of these reactors
  • identify a scheduling order for calling the reactors synchronization from the least dependent to the most dependent.

The scheduling order is stored in the list this callback points to and can be used after the depth first search by the Agent to execue the synchronization of each reactors.

Note:
We may in the future embeds the synchronization call of the reactors directly into this search. Even though it may be more efficient -- as we would avoid to have to construct this list and then iterate though it. We have yet to check and verify that such approach would be valid as it would interleave the calls of newTick and synchronize of the reactors which may -- or may not -- be problematic.

Agent

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Definition at line 106 of file Agent.cc.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::list<graph::reactor_id> TREX::agent::details::sync_scheduller::reactor_queue

scheduling queue type

The type of the queue which is used to store the reactors in the scheduling order for synchronization.

This is just a simple list which can then be iterated from the beginning in order to go in a valid order for reactors execution

Definition at line 117 of file Agent.cc.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TREX::agent::details::sync_scheduller::sync_scheduller ( reactor_queue &  sync_order  )  [inline, explicit]

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in,out] sync_order A reference to the list where the schduling order should be stored

Create A new instance that will put the reactor synchronization scheduling into the list referred by sync_order

Note:
As boost graph library passes visitors by copy it is necessary here to have this list maintained as a reference to the list. Otherwise we would loose the information of this scheduling as soon as the search complete.

Member Function Documentation

void TREX::agent::CycleDetector::back_edge ( TREX::transaction::graph::relation_type const &  rel,
TREX::transaction::graph const &  g 
) [inline, inherited]

back edge callback

This dfs callback is called only when the dfs loops back to a vertex that is still being explored. This clearly idenitfy a loop in the graph wwhich is a proof of cyclic dependncy betwee two reactors

Exceptions:
CycleDetected always thrown as this call indicates a cyclic dependency in the egent graph

First encounter of a reactor.

Parameters:
[in] r A reactor
[in] g The grah r belngs to

This method is called when the sarch encounter for the first time the reactor r. It calls the method newTick() to indicate to r that a new tick has started.

void TREX::agent::details::sync_scheduller::finish_vertex ( graph::reactor_id  r,
graph const &  g 
) [inline]

Finish vertex callback.

Parameters:
[in] r A reactor
[in] g The graph r is attached to

This method is called when the sarch has explored all the reactor r depends on. It can the insert this reactor at the end of the scheduling list ensuring that this reactor synchronization won't be executed before all the reactors it depend on have been synchronized
